poem:
### Extra Time

In the quiet corridors of Harrogate,  
the clocks stretch their arms wide.  
Kirstie, burdened with the weight of time,  
navigates a maze of accommodations.  
Invisible needs shape the air,  
as students settle into their chairs,  
a pause, a breath,  
a gift of seconds  
in the intricate dance  
of exams and expectations.
